result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Allen Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 0 (ZERO) days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $6,969.00 to LORIE K-H., $11,298.07 to AMERICAN ENTERTAINMENT, $1,000.00 to MULLIGAN'S c/o Teki D., $21,395.96 to be paid to BADGER MUTUAL during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

EACH COUNT:  All costs and surcharges, Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for work/school/treatment.  Court will allow electronic surveillance.  COURT STAYS 165 DAYS OF CONDITION TIME.  Upon release from in-patient treatment,  30 (THIRTY) days are to be served.

Defendant Christopher Allen Edwards in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is entering into Veteran's Treatment Initiative.  
 
AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant ordered to serve 12 (TWELVE) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to Count 1.
 
AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant ordered to serve 12 (TWELVE) MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 0 (ZERO) days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.  Court STAYED the sentence AS TO BOTH COUNTS and placed the defendant on probation for 36 (THIRTY-SIX) MONTHS with the following conditions:

*Serve 195 DAYS in the House of Correction.  Release privileges for work/school/treatment.  Court will allow electronic surveillance.  COURT STAYS 165 DAYS OF CONDITION TIME.  Upon release from in-patient treatment,  30 (THIRTY) days are to be served.

*Restitution in the amount of $6,969.00 to LORIE K-H., $11,298.07 to AMERICAN ENTERTAINMENT, $1,000.00 to MULLIGAN'S c/o Teki D., $21,395.96 to be paid to BADGER MUTUAL during period of probation, AS WELL AS all costs and surcharges.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Christopher Allen Edwards in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for calendar call. Sidebar placed on the record. Defendant has been accepted into veteran's court. Court approved the transfer of this matter to Branch 33 for a resolution. Case adjourned to Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Allen Edwards in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Parties are working towards having the defendant accepted into veteran's court. Court authorized the transfer of this case to Branch 33. Court ordered a calendar call be set in Branch 25 to check if the case had been accepted by Branch 33. Case adjourned to Branch 33.  Calendar call scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Allen Edwards in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Parties are looking into veteran's court as an alternative means of treatment and request an adjourned scheduling date. Court granted joint request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Allen Edwards in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Parties were advised by this clerk that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be assigned to Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case continued for plea before Branch 25 and that all terms and conditions of bail continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Allen Edwards in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trongeau motion heard.  Court overruled dismissal of Count 1, found probable cause and bound the matter over.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date to determine if defendant is eligible for Veteran's Court.  Court granted defense counsel's requset and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Case remains calendared before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State requested a transcript of initial appearance; however, transcript not yet prepared.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion to Review Dismissal by Judicial Court Commissioner filed.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/14/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-18-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mulligan Bar., Lori K.H., Teki D. and the Landmark Tavern
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Christopher Allen Edwards in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Court's own Motion, Court DISMISSED Count ONE. AS TO COUNT TWO:
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference in Branch 20.vb
